creditline:
John DeLaittre Memorial Collection
Gift of funds from Mrs. Horace Ropes
medium: Watercolor, pen and brown ink, over graphite
text: Rowlandson, who was assiduous at dissections, represents here the new approach to art in 18th- century Britain, when anatomical knowledge became fundamental to the artist's training. In this caricature, Professor William Hunter lectures—skull in hand—from a podium where skeletons and human bones parade with casts from famous antique sculptures.
title: An Anatomical Lecture at Royal Academy of Arts
